sections.title: Career Summary
sections.summary: Recent graduate with a Master's degree in Geomatics, specializing in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial data analysis. Experienced in analyzing forest cover changes using historical and modern imagery. Holds a B.A. in International Relations, with a strong interest in the intersection of geospatial analysis, international development, and humanitarian work. Combines analytical, cross-cultural, and communication skills to support research and policy initiatives on complex environmental and social issues.

items.degree: Master of Geomatics in Environmental Management (MGEM)
details: Developed skills in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial data analysis through hands-on projects to support environmental management and decision-making

items.degree: Bachelor of Arts in International Relations
details: Studied global governance, development policies, and international cooperation frameworks

items.name: Forest Cover Change Analysis
items.description: Analyzed forest cover changes in British Columbia using Landsat imagery from 1984 to 2023. Applied machine learning algorithms in Google Earth Engine to classify land use changes and assess deforestation patterns.

items.name: Spatial Data Visualization Dashboard
items.description: Developed an interactive web dashboard for visualizing environmental monitoring data using ArcGIS StoryMaps and Python. Created automated data processing workflows for real-time environmental indicators.

items.name: International Development Research
items.description: Conducted research on sustainable development practices in Southeast Asia, analyzing policy frameworks and their effectiveness in addressing climate change adaptation strategies.
Support faculty research on climate change impacts using geospatial analysis techniques.
highlights: Process and analyze satellite imagery for environmental monitoring projects
Develop automated workflows for large-scale spatial data processing
Collaborate with interdisciplinary team on publication-ready research outputs

items.description: Supported regional planning initiatives through spatial data analysis and mapping.
highlights: Created detailed maps and spatial analyses for regional growth management
Maintained and updated regional geographic databases
Prepared technical reports and presentations for planning committees

items.description: Coordinated ecological monitoring programs in remote wilderness areas.
highlights: Managed field teams conducting biodiversity surveys in remote locations
Implemented GPS data collection protocols for species mapping
Trained volunteers in ecological monitoring techniques and safety procedures

items.description: Lead educational programs about urban ecology and conservation.
Respond to emergency calls for missing persons in mountainous terrain.

items.name: Faculty of Arts International Student Scholarship
Top Graduate Award in International Relations
